meanings.definition: The act of making a problem or situation worse.
meanings.sent1: Her constant complaints only added to the aggravation of the situation.
meanings.sent2: The delay in the delivery was an aggravation for the customers.
meanings.sent3: Trying to fix the leaky faucet turned into an aggravation when the pipe burst.
meanings.sent4: The never-ending traffic jam was an aggravation that felt like being stuck in a maze.
meanings.sent5: The aggravation of losing her keys made her late for the meeting.

meanings.definition: A feeling of annoyance or frustration.
meanings.sent1: His constant interruptions caused me great aggravation during the presentation.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't hide her aggravation when her computer froze again.
meanings.sent3: The cat's playful antics turned from cute to aggravation when it knocked over the vase.
meanings.sent4: The aggravation of waiting in line felt like time standing still.
meanings.sent5: The aggravation of dealing with the automated phone system made him want to scream.

meanings.definition: Something that causes annoyance or frustration.
meanings.sent1: The broken elevator was an aggravation for the residents of the building.
meanings.sent2: The constant noise from the construction site was a source of aggravation for the office workers.
meanings.sent3: The missing ingredients for the recipe turned into an aggravation when the store was closed.
meanings.sent4: The aggravation of a dripping faucet echoed through the quiet house at night.
meanings.sent5: The aggravation of a slow internet connection made online work unbearable.
